title: Tulisa dons a violet power suit and platinum wig for Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards
text:
She recently returned from a luxury break on the Greek island of Mykonos, where she was seen sunning herself with a group of pals.

And Tulisa Contostavlos appeared rested and happy when she stepped out sporting a new look at the Specsavers Wearer of the Year Awards in London on Tuesday night.

The former X Factor judge, 31, caught the eye as she arrived at 8 Northumberland Avenue wearing a violet power suit, which she teamed with a bold platinum wig.

Stepping out: Tulisa Contostavlos was among the attendees at the Specsavers Wearer of the Year Awards, held at London's 8 Northumberland Avenue on Tuesday night

Standing tall in a pair of vertiginous purple heels, the singer changed things up by shunning her usual long black locks and donning secretary-inspired glasses.

The star, who shot to fame as a member of hip-hop group N-Dubz, recently treated fans to snippets of her travels on Instagram.

Tulisa, who released her solo album The Female Boss in 2012, has been performing again as of late and most recently took to the stage at Manchester Pride in August.

Sporting a new look: The north London native sported a new look for her night on the town

Lavender chic: Tulisa, 31, also caught the eye in a violet power suit and channelled her inner Kylie Jenner with a platinum wig

Earlier this year, Tulisa said she was excited to return to the spotlight – although she had to prepare herself for the scrutiny of being in the public eye.

She said on ITV's Loose Women: 'It had to be right. There’s no point putting music out there for the fact of putting music out there, I had to take some time, think about what I wanted.

'I’m not superhuman, what I told myself was tough love, this is all I have known and what I’ve done all my life.

Strike a pose: The singer posed up a storm on the carpet as she arrived at the glitzy event

Busty display: Tulisa flashed a hint of cleavage as she strutted into the award ceremony

'You know what it sounds cliché but it’s like riding a bike you've either got it in you or you haven’t.

'Singing music and entertaining is always something I have wanted to do it is there or it isn’t.'

Tulisa first shot to fame as a member of multi platinum selling band N-Dubz, where they achieved two platinum albums, a UK No.1 single, sold more than four million records and won four MOBO Awards.
description: She recently returned from a luxury break on the Greek island of Mykonos, where she was seen sunning herself with a group of pals.
